metadata.synopsis: This dialogue is peak Wulbren. If he's met you in haven (after you saved him), he rolls back on how rude he was as he realises the player would be an amazing asset in the city. If this is your first time meeting him since the escape (if haven is destroyed he waits out on the river until this scene in the epilogue), he realises how good the player would be to have on his side in the city and tells him all about how wronged the ironhand gnomes were.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. run oe SCE_SetupGnomes_SetFlags2. Runoe SCE_SetupGnomes_AllGnomes-or-oe SCE_SetupGnomes_NoBarcus-or-oe SCE_SetupGnomes_DeadN-or-oe SCE_SetupGnomes_DeadWulbren3. Run oe SCE_SetupDebrief4. Go to Act 2 Coordinates X:-166 Y:-170 (Moonrise Bazaar)5. Engage one of the gnomes in dialogue

4.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
4.text: We'll be heading for Baldur's Gate soon. If fate wills it, I'll see you there.

17.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
17.text: Bring every scrap of courage you have to Baldur's Gate - you'll need it for what's to come.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: It's Barcus you should apologise to. Your reunion in Last Light was... strained.

76.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
76.text: Barcus and I are another matter - I'm dealing with you right now.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I kill Ketheric, and suddenly we're friends, are we?

9.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
9.text: In a sense - yes. But that's because I didn't know what you were capable of.

40.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
40.text: I saw you as a means to escape, nothing more. But when the sky lit up - when I followed it here - I knew you were behind it.

30.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
30.text: I apologise - for not seeing your true worth. And for being, quite frankly, rude in Last Light.

7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
7.text: I wasn't sure you would - I appreciate it.

14.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
14.text: And that's precisely why I want you by my side in Baldur's Gate.
14.context: NodeContext: to wulbren, this is a huge deal to offer the player

39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
39.text: The Ironhand Gnomes are going to save the city - and you can be part of it.
39.context: NodeContext: sincere and grave - this is a huge thing for wulbren to offer

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Gently pierce the veil of his mind, probing for his true intentions.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *You see a column of fire that dominates the sky in a blazing inferno - nothing more.*

60.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
60.text: Well? Will you help me or not?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: If you want my help, I'm going to need more to go on.

83.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
83.text: The plan is what it's always been - to bring the work and innovations of the Ironhand Gnomes to every corner of the realm.

38.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
38.text: Problem is, Baldur's Gate is sick. Once the pinnacle of greatness, it's eating itself alive to save itself from starving.
38.context: NodeContext: slight hint of gravity here - player should wonder what he's planning

33.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
33.text: Find me in the city - once you see what it's become, you'll know that I and I alone can stop it.

49.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
49.text: We're outnumbered, my friend - and secrecy is a slim advantage. I'll tell you more in the city.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Doing a job without information is a surefire way to get caught. Spill.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: If I can help, I will.

25.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
25.text: That's what I like to hear. Find me in the city - and together, we can save Baldur's Gate from itself.

26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
26.text: Wait until you reach the city. Once you see what it's become, you'll know the Ironhand Gnomes are needed.

24.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
24.text: But I stand by what I said before - you and I were meant to meet. And together, we'll save Baldur's Gate from itself.

87.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
87.context: NodeContext: a slight smile - player just called him an asshole

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I can be rude myself sometimes.

36.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
36.text: Gracious as well as impressive - a fine combination.

84.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
84.text: Find us in Baldur's Gate. You'll see the Ironhand Gnomes in a new light - I guarantee it.

88.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
88.text: You helped me escape this hellspit, then took down the heart of Moonrise - Ketheric himself. I'm impressed.

29.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
29.text: And I'm not a man easily impressed.

82.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
82.text: Indeed. You're worth ten of my own crew - that is clear to see.

71.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
71.text: Hence why you're here, and they're dead.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Last I saw you, you were disappearing on a boat down the river.

12.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
12.text: Not my finest exit. I hid out on the river until the sky lit up. Couldn't believe my eyes - especially when I realised you were behind it.

50.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
50.text: I underestimated you. Kept who I was, and who I represent, from you - but I see now that was a mistake.

37.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
37.text: I am Wulbren Bongle, leader of the Ironhand Gnomes. No doubt you've heard of us?

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *You recall stories of the Ironhand Gnomes - a talented group of inventors who were banished from Baldur's Gate.*

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I met some Ironhand Gnomes looking for runepowder in the Underdark - any idea why?

57.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
57.text: To use it as all innovators do - for the good of the realm. Nothing to concern yourself with.
57.context: NodeContext: slight smirk here at his own inside joke

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Weren't your people exiled from Baldur's Gate?

77.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
77.text: Do not speak of a story you only know the half of.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I don't know much, I'm afraid.

63.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
63.text: We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.

16.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
16.text: But our forebears were foolish - complicit with Sarevok's madness over a century past, and so we were banished. Still are to this day.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I'm no scholar of history - what are you talking about?

75.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
75.text: Sarevok was a madman and a murderer. He brought Baldur's Gate to the brink of destruction. And we were fool enough to work with him.

86.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
86.text: The very one. It's the only mistake the Ironhand Gnomes ever made - and it cost us everything.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Siding with a murderous lunatic is more than 'foolish'.

66.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
66.text: Perhaps. But why should I be punished for a mistake I took no part in?

34.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
34.text: You agree with such machinations? Duly noted.

54.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
54.text: I've fought tooth and nail to restore our reputation. Particularly against Gondian detractors who live in glass houses.

20.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
20.text: I've filled appeals - pleaded with the High Artificer himself. They've refused us time and again. Now, however, I will make them listen.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

78.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
78.text: Plenty. Find me in the city, and help us save Baldur's Gate from itself.

56.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
56.text: Our cause is just and righteous, friend. That's all the luck we need.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Were I a Gondian, I'd keep you out of the city too.

6.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
6.text: *Sigh.* Foolish and ignorant, like the rest. But you'll change your mind once you see what's become of Baldur's Gate, I have no doubt.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Go on. I'm sure you're dying to tell me all about the Ironhand Gnomes.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: There are few as innovative as the Ironhand Gnomes. Your creations were ingenious.

92.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
92.text: Thank you, but there is no 'were'. We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.
92.context: NodeContext: clearly carries hate towards the gondians

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Inventors? Traitors, more like. Every gnome in Baldur's Gate suffered for your treachery.

22.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
22.text: I see Gondian propaganda is alive and well. We match the High House of Wonders in design. Innovation. Brilliance.

68.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
68.text: Yet they banished us from Baldur's Gate. And for what?

65.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
65.text: Yes, our forebears were complicit with Sarevok's madness. But it was a century ago, and nothing more than foolishness.

13.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
13.text: Heh. That's I like to hear. You're worth ten of my crew.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I believe the words you're looking for are 'thank you'.

90.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
90.text: I was getting to that, but all right - thank you.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Have you forgotten the bit where you left me behind.

55.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
55.text: It was out of pure necessity - I imagine you'd have done the same if our roles were reversed.
55.context: NodeContext: dodging player's accusations, turning it back on them

91.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
91.text: Back in my cell, I didn't tell you everything - about who I was, and more importantly, who I represent.
